Map

Class Map

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Observable
      • Map.Map

  • public class Map
extends java.util.Observable
    This class is used to create a full Map, a map has a list of continents and territories. A continent is just a sub Map which is part of the overall map.
    Since:
    2018-09-30
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Mandeep Ahlawat

    • Method Detail

      • findTerritory

        public static Map.Territory findTerritory(java.lang.String territoryName)
        This method is used to find a Territory.
        Parameters:
        territoryName - A String value of the territory name.
        Returns:
        Territory if territory is found then returns territory otherwise. returns null.

      • allTerritoriesOwnBySinglePlayer

        public boolean allTerritoriesOwnBySinglePlayer(boolean notifyObserver)
        The method will display all territories owned by a single player in the game.
        Parameters:
        notifyObserver - a boolean value if you want to notify the observers or not
        Returns:
        true if it satisfies all the conditions otherwise it will return false.

      • findContinent

        public static Map findContinent(java.lang.String continentName)
        This method is used to find a Continent.
        Parameters:
        continentName - A String value of the continent name.
        Returns:
        Continent if continent is found then returns continent otherwise returns null.

      • addContinent

        public boolean addContinent(java.lang.String continentName,
                            int continentScore)
        This method is used to add a continent to the Map.
        Parameters:
        continentName - A String value of the continent name.
        continentScore - A integer value of the continent score.
        Returns:
        true if the continent is not already created, otherwise returns false as a continent with the same already exists.

      • validateMap

        public boolean validateMap()
        This method is used to validate the map by carrying out depth first search (DFS) on a graph of territories. If after the DFS any territory is left unvisited then the graph is not connected and the function returns false. Otherwise, if all the territories are visited, the resulting graph is connected and the method returns true. Also, this method marks continent as visited as we implement DFS, in order to check that there is no continent without any territory assigned to it.
        Returns:
        true if the map is connected.
